title: Raytheon wins $511 mln U.S. defense contract - Pentagon
text: March 16, 2018 / 11:20 PM / in an hour Raytheon wins $511 million U.S. defense contract: Pentagon Reuters Staff 1 Min Read WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Raytheon Co has been awarded a $511 million contract for the Cobra Dane radar, the Pentagon said on Friday. A sign marks the Raytheon offices in Woburn, Massachusetts, U.S. January 25, 2017. REUTERS/Brian Snyder The indefinite-delivery/indefinite-quantity contract is for tasks required to operate, maintain and sustain the Cobra Dane radar, the Pentagon said in a statement. Work will primarily be performed at Eareckson Air Station, Shemya, Alaska, and is expected to be complete by March 2025, it said. Reporting by Eric Walsh
